bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1948

div1.p: Siler discusses the plans to memorialize the room where Walter Reed died.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, January 15, 1948
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
January 15, 1948
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
Dr. P. S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thanks very much for your note of January 2nd. I am glad that
a copy of the minutes of the 1946 annual meeting finally reached you.

Thanks also for the information concerning the photographs which
you have sent to General Truby. I shall await his letter containing
the memorandum identifying the room in which Walter Reed died. I have
not as yet heard from General Truby and if you would like me to do so,
I would be very glad to consult with the Commanding Officer of Fort
McNair (formerly the Army War College) and secure a plan of the second
floor of the building in question.

Just as soon as all of this information comes to hand I will take
it up with General Kean and advise you as to his suggestions for the
exact phrasing to be placed on the plaques.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Col., U.S.A., Retired
Secretary, Walter Reed Memorial
Association jfs k
